title: Farshid Karimi
text:
Farshid Karimi (, born May 10, 1976) is a retired <a href="Iran">Iran</a>ian <a href="soccer">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28football%29">goalkeeper</a>. He is older brother of <a href="Ali%20Karimi%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201978%29">Ali Karimi</a>.
Club career.
Persepolis.
He started his career with Persepolis in 2000 when the club needed a goalkeeper, and he was introduced to <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20Ali%20Parvin">2007–08 Ali Parvin</a> by Sadegh Doroudgar to be on trial with the club. He joined Persepolis and played 8 seasons for them. He was <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a>'s first choice goalkeeper during <a href="2005%E2%80%9306%20Iran%20Pro%20League">2005–06</a> and <a href="2006%E2%80%9307%20Persian%20Gulf%20Cup">2006–07</a> seasons, and he became one of the key players of the team in the <a href="2005%E2%80%9306%20Hazfi%20Cup">2005–06 Hazfi Cup</a>. In the <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.%20season">2007–08</a> season, he became a benchwarmer after <a href="Hassan%20Roudbarian">Hassan Roudbarian</a> and <a href="Mehdi%20Vaezi">Mehdi Vaezi</a> and played just one match, which was his last appearance for Persepolis. On the match on February 10, 2008 against <a href="Aboomoslem%20FC">Aboumoslem</a> he played mistakenly, conceding 3 goals in the first half and was <a href="Booing">booed</a> by the fans, In the half time, he was asked by <a href="IRIB">IRIB</a> Reporter about his performance. "I have nothing to say", he replied. Persepolis scored in the second half making a 3-3 draw.
Damash.
He moved to the <a href="Gilan">Gilan</a>i Club <a href="Damash%20Gilan%20F.C.">Damash</a> in <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20Persian%20Gulf%20Cup">2008–09</a> and was Second Goalie of <a href="Ali%20Nazarmohammadi">Ali Nazarmohammadi</a>. He had problems with the Club after <a href="Amir%20Abedini">Amir Abedini</a> did not pay his wage in time, so he complained and left training. Abedini Fired him from the club. He was later fined about $2000 of his contract due to "his insolence to Chairman Abedini" and returned to trainings after compromise with the club.
Rah Ahan.
He joined <a href="Rah%20Ahan%20F.C.">Rah Ahan</a> in 2009. He played one season alongside <a href="Masoud%20Homami">Masoud Homami</a>. He remained in the next season with the club. Other goalies were <a href="Hassan%20Roudbarian">Hassan Roudbarian</a> and <a href="Saleh%20Khalil%20Azad">Saleh Khalil Azad</a>. He rejected a transfer to <a href="Steel%20Azin">Steel Azin</a> in December 2010. He was released by the club on 1 July 2013.
Aluminium.
In summer 2013, he signed a two years contract with <a href="Aluminium%20Hormozgan%20F.C.">Aluminium</a>, who relegated from <a href="Iran%20Pro%20League">Iran Pro League</a> to <a href="Azadegan%20League">Division 1</a> <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Iran%20Pro%20League">last season</a>.
International career.
He was called up for <a href="team%20melli">team melli</a> once by <a href="Amir%20Ghalenoei">Amir Ghalenoei</a> in 2006, but never made a debut.
